column4: Anyone knows why my apache2 won't follow symlinks although in configuration it is turned on?
maybe wrong rights on the destination file?
Am linking directory.
0775 on all files.
Yes.
drwxrwxr-x 10 meaneye meaneye 4096 2011-11-03 09:31 Web
You don't have permission to access /shenkin on this server.
on what user runs your apache? (i think default is www-data)
default one... www-data
Tried, not working. But I'll try again.
Same.
Yeah. I've been hitting my head with this for an hour now.
Okies.
how did you enable the symlinks?
They should be enabled by default... but yes... that's the way they are enabled.
not a vhost, just default /var/www site.
Weird, I know. And usually it worked out of the box... Now it doesn't.
Hm, I could create vhost. The same way phpmyadmin is doing. That would solve my problem I guess.
I'll do it that way. Thank you anyway :D
Thanks. :D
Weird. Even with alias I get the same error. It's deffinately problem with permissions but I fail to see what.
can u compare permissions of the phpmyadmin folder and yours?
Any luck?
